intro: Thlaspeocarpa namaquensis, commonly known as the Namaqua daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, elongated fruits that contain the seeds. Thlaspeocarpa namaquensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in low-water conditions.
